program_summary: Cohort nine, powered by Libro Credit Union in partnership with Communitech, the Government of Ontario, and FedDev Ontario, is designed for companies ready to grow, build momentum, and explore new opportunities while making a regional economic impact to Windsor-Essex and/or Chatham-Kent (see Program Guide for full details). Tailored to meet their specific needs by working with a team of dedicated expert mentors, participants will delve deep into optimizing operations, expanding market reach, and
program_full_description: Cohort nine, powered by Libro Credit Union in partnership with Communitech, the Government of Ontario, and FedDev Ontario, is designed for companies ready to grow, build momentum, and explore new opportunities while making a regional economic impact to Windsor-Essex and/or Chatham-Kent (see Program Guide for full details). Tailored to meet their specific needs by working with a team of dedicated expert mentors, participants will delve deep into optimizing operations, expanding market reach, and enhancing product/service offerings. The program also offers participants an opportunity to increase their exposure to various media outlets, increasing their visibility and making it easier to attract investment, customers and strategic partnerships. Curated workshops and training sessions such as Investment Readiness and Pitch Preparation Peer Founder Sessions for collaborative problem solving and accountability Mentorship through the University of Windsor WEsecure Cyber Protection program including full security audits, disaster mitigation, and 6 months of SOC 2 monitoring
services_offered: 30 hours of direct engagement with a team of dedicated expert Growth Coaches
Curated workshops and training sessions such as Investment Readiness and Pitch Preparation
Peer Founder Sessions for collaborative problem solving and accountability
Mentorship through the University of Windsor WEsecure Cyber Protection program including full security audits, disaster mitigation, and 6 months of SOC 2 monitoring
Opportunity to present at the final Showcase with dedicated booth space
Opportunity to compete at the final Pitch Competition for a $20,000 grand prize

Must be EITHER:

Headquartered in Windsor-Essex or Chatham-Kent OR 
Be a WEtech-supported company or a client of one the following WEtech partners: Communitech; the Accelerator Centre; Conestoga College; MACcelerate
Headquartered in Windsor-Essex or Chatham-Kent OR
Be a WEtech-supported company or a client of one the following WEtech partners: Communitech; the Accelerator Centre; Conestoga College; MACcelerate
Must have a product or service in market or ready to launch
Business must have a scalable product or service and be tech or innovation centred
Business must be Small to Medium Enterprise (1-499 employees)
Business must have founder or at least one staff working on the project full time hours
One member of the leadership team must participate in the program and attend all mandatory meetings
Headquartered in Windsor-Essex or Chatham-Kent OR
Be a WEtech-supported company or a client of one the following WEtech partners: Communitech; the Accelerator Centre; Conestoga College; MACcelerate

program_summary: This program will provide specialized industry expertise to develop growth plans and related strategies in areas such as talent attraction, raising follow-on investment, product development and quantification of product benefits/market value propositions, commercialization of intellectual property, and market diversification. Each RIC will distribute up to a maximum of $20,000 in matching seed funding to select innovative businesses in various sectors. • Non-repayable seed funding of up to $20,0
program_full_description: This program will provide specialized industry expertise to develop growth plans and related strategies in areas such as talent attraction, raising follow-on investment, product development and quantification of product benefits/market value propositions, commercialization of intellectual property, and market diversification. Each RIC will distribute up to a maximum of $20,000 in matching seed funding to select innovative businesses in various sectors. • Non-repayable seed funding of up to $20,000 with matching funds • Up to 30 hours of fully funded, targeted support from business leaders Our experts have the knowledge and experience to help you address challenges and move your business forward in all areas including: • growth plans and strategies • talent attraction • raising follow-on investment • market diversification • product development • quantification of product benefits • market value propositions • commercialization of intellectual property • and more
eligibility:
What are the eligibility requirements to participate in this program?

One or two team members of the business’ leadership team are available to participate in the
program
The applicant must be an early-stage business or Small to Medium Enterprise (1-499 employees),
and the business must be headquartered in Southern Ontario (regions are outlined in Appendix A)
Business must be incorporated (Ontario or federal)
Business owner/founder must be working in the business full-time
Business must have a scalable product or service
One team member is available to participate in an online program with the University of Guelph
during the project timeframe.
services_offered: 50% of activity seed financing released once an initial diagnostic and work plan has been completed by the recipient and their assigned lead expert, including goals and milestone.
25% of activity seed financing released upon recommendation of the lead project expert and completion of their interim report.

25% of the activity seed financing released upon completion of the project and the approval of the final reporting requirements. This means that the participant must spend both the grant money AND their matching funds before receiving the final 25% of the grant money. The project may be close to 100% complete.

One or two team members of the business’ leadership team are available to participate in the
program

The applicant must be an early-stage business or Small to Medium Enterprise (1-499 employees),
and the business must be headquartered in Southern Ontario (regions are outlined in Appendix A)
Business must be incorporated (Ontario or federal)
Business owner/founder must be working in the business full-time
Business must have a scalable product or service

One team member is available to participate in an online program with the University of Guelph
during the project timeframe.
Idea: Entrepreneur with idea; initial market and technology exploration.
Discovery: Value proposition established; testing ideas; proof of concept; identifying customers; early financials; Friends and Family funding.
Validation: Business model established; minimum viable product; customer verified; initial orders; testing go-to-market strategy; pursuing angel funding or in accelerator
Efficiency: Initial market traction; scaling sales and marketing; demand creation; forecasting based on actuals; pursuing early-stage VC.
Scale: Validated product and market; customer growth; established management team; pursuing later-stage investment.

program_summary: Thinking about starting your own business? Have an idea that you want to commercialize? Do you have an existing business and want to diversify your revenue streams? PLUS, discover who WEtech Alliance is, and how we help innovative and tech-based entrepreneurs and companies Start, Sell and Scale. Be sure to follow our Eventbrite page to be notified when additional sessions are added.
program_full_description: Thinking about starting your own business? Have an idea that you want to commercialize? Do you have an existing business and want to diversify your revenue streams? PLUS, discover who WEtech Alliance is, and how we help innovative and tech-based entrepreneurs and companies Start, Sell and Scale. Be sure to follow our Eventbrite page to be notified when additional sessions are added.

program_summary: WEtech Alliance is 1 of 17 Regional Innovation Centres (RICs) across the Province of Ontario. This network grants WEtech Alliance access to an exclusive suite of programs for our clients. WEtech Alliance is always looking to collaborate with new corporate sponsors to curate exclusive deals for our portfolio clients.
program_full_description: WEtech Alliance is 1 of 17 Regional Innovation Centres (RICs) across the Province of Ontario. This network grants WEtech Alliance access to an exclusive suite of programs for our clients. WEtech Alliance is always looking to collaborate with new corporate sponsors to curate exclusive deals for our portfolio clients.

program_summary: This Peer Group welcomes a diverse and inclusive group of women, non-binary, and female-identifying individuals. Everyone is welcome to discuss the future of mobility and collaboratively create a better transport future. Join us for a unique meetup featuring an exclusive guided tour of Streetcar No. 351—an iconic piece of Windsor’s mobility past.
program_full_description: This Peer Group welcomes a diverse and inclusive group of women, non-binary, and female-identifying individuals. Everyone is welcome to discuss the future of mobility and collaboratively create a better transport future. Join us for a unique meetup featuring an exclusive guided tour of Streetcar No. 351—an iconic piece of Windsor’s mobility past.
